metadata.title: CVE-2019-12528 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.10. It allows a crafted FTPserver to trigger disclosure of sensitive information from heap memory,such as information associated with other users' sessions or non-Squidprocesses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.9-2ubuntu4
squid-cgi - 4.9-2ubuntu4
squid-common - 4.9-2ubuntu4
squid-purge - 4.9-2ubuntu4
squid3 - 4.9-2ubuntu4
squidclient - 4.9-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9-2ubuntu4').
